comment.body: @nofish is feasible to use merged sites to mirror something like wikipedia ?
@Talnicrom: exactly, we will need a second level of hubs (super hubs) for easier seeding
@Talnicrom: i need to think more about this hehe
@Talnicrom: i was thing like hub=category and super hub=portal
@Talnicrom @nofish by the way dont u think there can can be a diff option when a zsite say cloned from to compare them? this can be relevant for a wiki no ?
@Talnicrom: wikipedia have the talk section so a zerowiki article can borrow zeroblog comment feature no ?

@Talnicrom: something like this ? a page about Tesla can be a sum of many individual pieces of data for example placing [/19M1DT5vruSATEcbEczYRwCk2uPuLcATBa/29] will automatically insert the content in the article, so comments made anywhere in the hub can be inserted and avoid data duplication because you no longer have the comment copied and then pasted in the article
